intro: Acrostichum eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a rough texture. The flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow and orange, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
